text: COMMUNITY REQUEST > if you are enjoying using Digital Rebar, please consider Tweeting at @digitalrebar and giving the project a github star <https://github.com/digitalrebar/provision>.  Spreading the word about the project helps us continue to expand it.  Thank you!

attachments.title: digitalrebar/provision
attachments.text: Digital Rebar Provision is a simple and powerful Golang executable that provides a complete API-driven DHCP/PXE/TFTP provisioning system.

text: <@UA29Z3MN0> has joined the channel
<@UA29Z3MN0> $welcome !
Digital Rebar welcome information is here > <http://rebar.digital/community/welcome.html>
thanks
great update on Terraform:  <http://provision.readthedocs.io/en/tip/doc/integrations/terraform.html>
NOTE: we've tested the patch on tip that eliminates the extra reboot in the demo above.
in a template how can I access a nested field inside the gohai-inventory
<@UA02EUXF1> - "it depends" ... what tools (eg Bash, Python, etc...) are you using that you want to parse the JSON ?
if it's Bash - likely your best friend is using the `jq` tool
we have a couple examples of parsing JSON via `jq` in our $faq pages at the end
FAQs are here > <http://provision.readthedocs.io/en/tip/doc/faq-troubleshooting.html>
so I have to pass the entire parameter to a variable in my bash script and parse it with jq? I was hoping to access just the field that I need like in ruby ```<%= gohai['bios']['vendor'] %>```

Gohai inventory is held as JSON key/value info on the DRP server-side ... parsing with `jq` is "sorta" the same - but not quite ... like you gathered, you have to pass all of gohai inventory to `jq` to pull out the specific keys you want ...

however - your interest is not at all unreasonable - I'll talk to <@U02DGQYK1> and <@U02DJQSG8> about adding Golang Template helpers to parse Gohai Inventory similarly to what you're asking - if it's possible - it'd be something like 
`{{ .Gohai ".bios.vendor" }}` 
taking a random stab at how it might look as a Golang template helper
but at the moment - sorry ... doesn't exist
ok, we actually tried something similar to that after looking at some examples, thanks for the help

if you don't mind filing a feature request - this helps us to prioritize and take action on feature requests like this .... 
<https://github.com/digitalrebar/provision/issues/new>
